questions.text: Perhaps the most famous pirate of all is Captain Kidd. What was his ultimate fate?
questions.explanation:
He was hanged.

	Kidd met the fate of many pirates - at the end of a rope.

questions.text: 'Blackbeard' is also one of the most famous pirates. What was his real name?
questions.explanation:
Edward Teach.

	Maynard is the officer who killed Blackbeard.

questions.text: This island was a legendary haven for many pirates.
questions.explanation:
Tortuga.

	It's mentioned in countless tales of pirate adventure.

questions.text: The flag that sailed atop many pirate ships was called what?
Francis Drake was a buccaneer who led a colorful life. Which statement is NOT true of him?
questions.correct: Drake's memoirs created a scandal when published after his death
options: He fought for England against the Spanish Armada
questions.explanation:
Drake's memoirs created a scandal when published after his death.

	Quite a life - but no memoirs.

questions.text: The most famous fictional pirate is probably Long John Silver. Name the author who created him.
questions.explanation:
Robert Louis Stevenson.

	'Treasure Island', with Jim Hawkins as protagonist. Defoe did 'Robinson Crusoe', which was based on the true story of a marooned member of a pirate crew.

questions.text: Jean Lafitte was a pirate who provided assistance to America in what war?
questions.explanation:
War of 1812.

	Specifically, the Battle of New Orleans.

questions.text: Which of these pirates is perhaps best known for his daring raid on Panama?
questions.explanation:
Henry Morgan.

	Morgan had a colorful and exciting life.

questions.text: This island has been the subject of treasure hunting and speculation about buried pirate treasure.
questions.explanation:
Oak Island.

	The legend of Oak Island is fascinating. What's down there? Who put it there? How? Why?

questions.text: This legendary author of children's books wrote a classic about pirates.
questions.explanation:
Howard Pyle.

	It's hard to find now - out of print - but boys will love it.("Howard Pyle's Book of Pirates", I believe.)
